stories.title: Venezuela frees nearly 2,200 under new amnesty lawPublished3 hours agoLawmaker Jorge Arreaza said Monday that releases have surged since the legislation took effect Friday, though critics say many political prisoners remain excluded.43 sources
Slovakia cuts emergency power to Ukraine over oil dispute54 sources
2026 is deadliest start to a year for Mediterranean migrants, UN says34 sources
Trump weighs new national security tariffs on six industries88 sources

Maryland sues to block ICE detention center near WilliamsportPublished4 hours agoAttorney General Anthony Brown alleges DHS spent $102.4 million on a warehouse without required environmental review or public input.34 sources

Anthropic says Chinese AI labs used 24,000 fake accounts to copy ClaudePublished8 hours agoThe company alleges DeepSeek, Moonshot AI, and MiniMax prompted its chatbot over 16 million times to extract advanced capabilities for their own models.61 sources
Trump dismisses Pentagon warnings about Iran strike risks39 sources
Nick Reiner pleads not guilty to murdering parents Rob and Michele Reiner37 sources
Peter Mandelson arrested in probe tied to Epstein39 sources

Johnson says Congress unlikely to codify Trump's tariffs after court rulingPublished5 hours agoThe House speaker said finding legislative consensus on trade policy will be difficult as new 15% tariffs face a July expiration date.73 sources

Virginia Senate moves to end $1B data center tax break42 sources

Epstein hid computers, photos in secret storage units across the US, report findsPublished11 hours agoThe Telegraph's investigation found the convicted sex offender leased at least six units in Florida and New York that authorities apparently never raided.44 sources

Supreme Court to hear oil firms' bid to block climate lawsuitsPublished12 hours agoThe justices agreed to review whether federal law bars cities and counties from suing fossil fuel companies under state law for climate change damages.45 sources

Ukraine marks 4 years of war with nearly 2 million casualties and no peace deal42 sources
Congo Basin lakes venting thousands-year-old carbon, study finds34 sources

OpenAI's $500B Stargate venture never got off the ground, report findsPublished16 hours agoThe joint venture with Oracle and SoftBank stalled over clashes on control and leadership, forcing OpenAI to pursue computing deals elsewhere.48 sources

YouTube exec denies platform was designed to addict childrenPublished10 minutes agoCristos Goodrow testified Monday in a landmark Los Angeles trial that YouTube aimed to deliver viewer value, not maximize screen time.81 sources

Apple to begin manufacturing Mac Mini in HoustonPublished31 minutes agoThe move makes the compact desktop Apple's second consumer product assembled in the U.S., alongside the Mac Pro built in Austin since 2013.97 sources

DeepSeek trained AI model on banned Nvidia chips, US official saysPublished1 hour agoA senior Trump administration official alleged that the Chinese AI startup used Nvidia's most advanced Blackwell chip despite U.S. export controls barring shipments to China.50 sources

Tesla sues California DMV to reverse false advertising ruling on self-driving claimsPublished3 hours agoDays after complying with corrective measures, the automaker filed suit to erase the finding that its Autopilot and FSD marketing misled consumers.42 sources
Uber to acquire parking app SpotHeroPublished5 hours agoThe deal will integrate SpotHero's parking reservation network across 400 North American cities directly into the Uber app.36 sources
Newborn hepatitis B vaccination fell sharply before CDC policy change, study finds43 sources
Study finds proto-writing on Stone Age artifacts in Germany from 40,000 years ago104 sources
Amazon to invest $12B in Louisiana data centers28 sources

Epstein tried to bring foreign women to SpaceX in 2013, Bloomberg reportsPublished7 hours agoDOJ emails show Jeffrey Epstein's assistant sent passports for three women ahead of his 2013 tour of Elon Musk's rocket facility.75 sources

Meta's AI safety director loses control of rogue OpenClaw agentPublished8 hours agoAn OpenClaw AI agent deleted over 200 emails from Summer Yue's inbox despite explicit instructions to wait for approval before acting.52 sources

Scientists discover horses whistle and sing at once53 sources

ASML says EUV light advance could yield 50% more chips by 2030Published12 hours agoThe Dutch firm boosted its lithography light source to 1,000 watts from 600, aiming to fend off emerging U.S. and Chinese rivals.57 sources

Silver surges past $87 as tariff chaos and geopolitical fears fuel safe-haven rushPublished11 minutes agoThe metal jumped roughly 6% on Monday, tripling gold's gains, as Trump's new tariffs and U.S.-Iran tensions rattled markets.71 sources

Dow sinks over 800 points as Trump's 15% tariffs take effect TuesdayPublished41 minutes agoWall Street sold off Monday as investors weighed the president's new global tariffs, announced days after the Supreme Court struck down his previous trade regime.59 sources
Cerebras confidentially files for US IPO againPublished1 hour agoThe AI chipmaker revived its public offering plans after withdrawing a previous filing in 2025, now valued at $23 billion.66 sources

Asian markets slide as AI fears and new tariffs compound Wall Street selloff80 sources

Supreme Court clears pilot union's fraud suit against BoeingPublished2 hours agoThe justices declined without dissent to hear Boeing's appeal, sending the 737 Max case to trial in Texas state court.44 sources

Bessent personally led January yen rate checkPublished2 hours agoThe U.S. Treasury secretary initiated the rare currency action without a request from Japan, aiming to prevent a global bond market spillover.60 sources
Dimon says he'll remain JPMorgan CEO for 'a few years'111 sources

FedEx sues US for full tariff refund after IEEPA duties struck down91 sources

Fed proposes rule barring examiners from using reputation risk in bank oversightPublished4 hours agoThe proposal would codify the Fed's June 2025 removal of reputation risk from examinations and open a 60-day public comment period.51 sources

DOJ, FTC launch effort to rewrite antitrust rules on competitor collaborationPublished5 hours agoThe agencies are seeking public input on algorithmic pricing, data sharing, and other modern practices not addressed in the original 2000 guidelines.51 sources
